work.name: AWS (Amazon)
highlights: Updated and created SOPs to improve the knowledge base for Amazon IT
Worked within Exchange Powershell for mailbox management and distribution group administration
Created custom bash scripts to automate repetitive tasks, reducing manual workload
Managed laptops and mobile devices using Jamf(MDM) to ensure security policies were enforced to protect company/user data
Provided support to engineers regarding cloud/developer instances
Updated the company's internal website using HTML/CSS & JavaScript
Managed all network connectivity (LAN/WAN, wireless, routing) and network infrastructure hardware using industry standard best practices
Managed Active Directory across all domains to ensure all user accounts and groups were functioning and up to date
Effectively managed equipment life cycles and provided input regarding annual budget

publications.name: Identity and Belonging among Diasporic Somali Youth in the GTA
publications.publisher: Prandium - The Journal of Historical Studies
publications.summary: A research about Somali youth within the GTA and their sense of belongingness within their families, community, and schools. Throughout the years, it is evident that Somali youth face many challenges within the categories listed, which is why I decided to take part in this study. I tend to dig deep and figure out why these challenges exist through one on one interviews and outline why the level of support does not exist for our youth.

projects.name: The Cloud Resume Challenge
projects.description: Hosted my resume on a static webpage using multiple cloud services and coding languages
highlights: Used HTML/CSS to style design the website
Hosted resume using the following AWS services: S3, CloudFront, and Route53
Worked with DynamoDB to create a table to store visitor counter data
Used Python to invoke a lambda function to communicate with DynamoDB to process website data
Converted AWS infrastructure into IaC using Terraform to promote safe, consistent, and trackable coding
